channel.title: Need some help with VBulletin! HELP ASAP!
channel.description:
Okay, I just bought VBulletin and i need some help installing it... I just got all the files uploaded into my Godaddy host but i need help with the config.php i can't seem to get it right. I get this error (well look for yourself): http://www.projectunknown.org/forums/
My msn is: Coolmanawesome1@hotmail.com
I NEED HELP ASAP!

item.title: Need some help with VBulletin! HELP ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

On another topic

Have your host support for PHP?

If it shows the database error, does it support PHP?

Idiot.

item.title: Need some help with VBulletin! HELP ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @solemage2 solemage2
item.description:
@solemage2 wrote:

WilD, go to your hosting account manager and make a database, and cal it forums,make the username forums.
then input like so, some times it ask for host url, if this does, click on your database and high light and copy the host url, might look like this 6554@secureserver.net or mimilar
db_name: forums
username: forums
password: password

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help with VBulletin! HELP ASAP!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Lol, nubzcake:

you have to create databases and put the names of the databases there, for example, make a database called something_something
where it says the name of the database in config.php, you bet something_something.
Make a user to use the database, and then just do that with it.

Ok:

config.php:
db_name: something_something
username: something_something
password: something

that’s all you have to edit, and make the permissions of it to 777.

Read full topic
